intro: Guillauminia rauhii, commonly known as the Rauh's guillauminia, is a rare and striking member of the Acanthaceae family. Native to South Africa, this plant is characterized by its vibrant, tubular flowers that range in color from red to orange. It typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils and thrives in full sun conditions. The plant features narrow, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in a fine, fuzzy texture. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a valuable species for botanical study and conservation efforts.
